articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: A trail of suspicious wills led to an organised gang committing fraud and stealing millions from dead people's estates.
articles.title: How fake-will fraudsters steal millions from the dead

articles.description: "Julian loved life," said the wife of the actor best known for roles in Nip/Tuck, FBI: Most Wanted and Fantastic Four.
articles.title: Julian McMahon: Charmed and Nip/Tuck actor dies aged 56

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The band stage a triumphant show in Cardiff, as they launch their long-awaited reunion tour.
articles.title: Oasis kick off their comeback: The best they've been since 1995

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Two young women speak to the BBC about why ketamine has become such a popular drug.
articles.title: Ketamine helped me escape my negative thoughts - then nearly killed me

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: UK Pride organisers tell the BBC that less sponsorship funding and fewer volunteers are behind cancelled events.
articles.title: London Pride returns as events struggle with falling funds

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Anna Gilkinson is one of many who claim they are being unfairly accused of fly-tipping by a private enforcement firm.
articles.title: 'It's got to be stopped' - why are people getting fly-tipping penalties?

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Priests and choristers at a crisis-hit cathedral did a "seven last shots of Christ" drinking game.
articles.title: Bangor Cathedral had 'binge drinking culture' at diocese

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Artisans who make Kolhapuri sandals are demanding better recognition after Prada failed to acknowledge design roots.
articles.title: Prada: Why Indian footwear artisans are upset with the luxury Italian label

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: A signing ceremony at the White House on Friday afternoon kicked off celebrations for 4 July.
articles.title: Trump signs his huge tax and spending bill into law

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Scientists find out how the epic deep sea migration of a tiny animal is storing planet-warming carbon.
articles.title: Tiny creature gorges, gets fat, and locks up planet-warming carbon
